creator: fpoirier@usherbrooke.ca
text:
Created attachment 33043
Corrected catalina.bat for starting tomcat Windows

Tomcat for Windows doesn't start, it's appear to be a variable definition error in catalina.bat

ERROR: '127.0.0.1' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.

You must remove the quotation marks of the following lines :
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% %LOGGING_MANAGER%
set JAVA_OPTS=%JAVA_OPTS% %LOGGING_CONFIG%

See corrected files in attachment.

The quotes are there for a good reason (bug 56895) and have been there since 8.0.13.

It looks like there is an issue with one of the variable values. The users mailing list is the place to seek help.
creator: markt@apache.org
